docs.snippet: One of pro basketball’s keenest coaching minds, Ramsay, who was known as Dr. Jack, spent more than 60 years in basketball as a player, head coach and broadcast analyst....
docs.lead_paragraph: One of pro basketball’s keenest coaching minds, Ramsay, who was known as Dr. Jack, spent more than 60 years in basketball as a player, head coach and broadcast analyst.
docs.abstract: Jack Ramsay, Hall of Fame coach who took Portland Trail Blazers to their only NBA championship and who was regarded as one of pro basketball’s keenest coaching minds, dies at age 89; he spent more than 60 years in basketball, as a player and coach and a TV and radio broadcast commentator and analyst, most recently for ESPN.

headline.main: Jack Ramsay, Who Led Blazers to 1977 N.B.A. Title, Dies at 89
headline.print_headline: Jack Ramsay, 89, Dies; Led Portland to an N.B.A. Title

docs.snippet: The case of the Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling recalls baseball’s handling of the Cincinnati Reds owner Marge Schott’s offensive behavior in the 1990s....
docs.lead_paragraph: The case of the Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling recalls baseball’s handling of the Cincinnati Reds owner Marge Schott’s offensive behavior in the 1990s.
docs.abstract: Any punishment handed down by NBA to Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling for his racist remarks will inevitably be compared with Major League Baseball’s actions in the 1990s against Cincinnati Reds owner Marge Schott over her offensive comments about blacks and Jews.

headline.main: Baseball Set Precedent for Disciplining an Owner
headline.print_headline: Baseball Set Precedent for Disciplining an Owner

docs.snippet: The National Basketball Association banned Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling from the game for life and fined him $2.5 million for racist comments, NBA Commissioner Adam Silver announced at a news conference in New York. Rough Cut (no rep...
docs.lead_paragraph: The National Basketball Association banned Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling from the game for life and fined him $2.5 million for racist comments, NBA Commissioner Adam Silver announced at a news conference in New York. Rough Cut (no reporter narration).

headline.main: NBA bans Clippers owner from game for life over racist comments
headline.sub: NBA bans Clippers owner from game for life over racist comments

headline.print_headline: Samsung Resumes Ads With LA Clippers After NBA's Decision

docs.snippet: Former NBA star and Sacramento Mayor Kevin Johnson has called for the NBA to suspend Donald Sterling indefinitely, appoint an executive or family member to run the team, and levy "the maximum fine possible" as punishment for the racist remarks pur...
docs.lead_paragraph: Former NBA star and Sacramento Mayor Kevin Johnson has called for the NBA to suspend Donald Sterling indefinitely, appoint an executive or family member to run the team, and levy "the maximum fine possible" as punishment for the racist remarks purportedly made by the Los Angeles Clippers' owner.

headline.main: Kevin Johnson Calls for Sterling to Be Suspended
headline.print_headline: Kevin Johnson Calls for Sterling to Be Suspended
